abstract.text: A semi-opaque type that represents symbolic matrix factorization.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Represents a symbolic matrix factorization (that is, the pattern of the factors without the values). A single symbolic factorization may be the basis for multiple numerical factorizations of matrices with the same pattern but different nonzero values.

function to free resources that these objects hold. The system reference-counts the internal factorize pointer, so it’s safe to destroy this object even if numeric factorizations exist that still depend on it.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A structure that represents the attributes of a matrix.
Releases a matrix factorization’s references to any memory that the Sparse Solvers library allocates.
Constants that define the factorization type.
A semi-opaque type that represents symbolic matrix factorization.
The attributes of the factorization.
The block size.
The number of columns.
Minimum size, in bytes, required to store numerical factors in doubles.
Minimum size, in bytes, required to store numerical factors in float.
A pointer to a private internal representation of the symbolic factor.
Creates an opaque symbolic factorization.
The number of rows.
The status of the factorization.
The factorization type.
Size, in bytes, of workspace required to perform numerical factorization in doubles.
Size, in bytes, of workspace required to perform numerical factorization in floats.
Constants that describe the status of a factorization.
A structure that contains options that affect the symbolic stage of a sparse factorization.
